text:
Charli Grace D'Amelio (born May 1, 2004) is an American social media personality and dancer. As of October 11, 2020, she has gained over 96 million followers on the social video sharing app TikTok, and has been called the "reigning queen of TikTok" by the "New York Times". She is the most-followed person on the platform.
D'Amelio's job began on TikTok in the summer of 2019 with uploaded dance videos. She has since gained over 50.1 million TikTok followers, 15.2 million Instagram followers, 2.58 million YouTube subscribers, and over 846 thousand Twitter followers. In just 10 months, she became the most-followed account on the social media platform TikTok.Now she has hit 100 million followers on the social media platform Tik Tok.
Personal life.
Her close family includes politician and father, Marc D'Amelio, her mother, Heidi D'Amelio, and her sister, Dixie D'Amelio.
D'Amelio has been bullied. She and her sister, Dixie, work with UNICEF, speaking out against online bullying and the troubles of finding fame on TikTok.
